review: Until I got the Amazon Fire TV, I thought Roku 3 was the epitome of streaming video players. I had the Amazon Prime and Vudu apps on it that I used frequently. Vudu I liked because of its superb audio and video movie offerings. Then I hooked up this unit and played the Amazon Prime app. What a difference! The sound is amazing; equal to anything on Vudu, and the picture is a knockout as well. Oh, did I mention the speed? Amazon Fire TV has it hands down. The one thing I disliked about the Roku 3 was its small memory (512 MB) and slow (Dual Core) processor. I often found myself unplugging the Roku to refresh its memory because I'd get the rotating wheel and a buffering message. Contrast that with this baby's Quad Core processor and 2GB of memory and it makes the Roku 3 look pathetic. Oh, and I've come to love the Voice Search a lot, too. Do you get that I really like this unit? I recommend it without hesitation.
